markdown: March 27, 1979 P. A. Willis, III, M.D. Summary: 1) Report disorganized, incomplete in parts, confused in format and not uniformly or well written. 2) Much above average performance in follow-up. 3) Average performance in weight reduction - below average in cholesterol, blood pressure and smoking control in SI group. - Weight - \u2193 1.9% versus 1.9% for all clinics @ 36 months - Cholesterol - \u2193 4.7% versus 6.5% for all clinics @ 36 months - Diastolic Blood Pressure - \u2193 6.5% versus 9.1% for all clinics @ 36 months - Smoking Quit Rate - \u2193 28% versus 36% for all clinics @ 36 months (corrected by thiocyanate - therefore in bottom 1/3) (uncorrected 44% versus 45% - therefore average middle 1/3) (corrected per CC on 7 variables 3% versus 16% therefore #22) 4) Excellent patient card returns 5) Low missed annual visit rates NW SI UC 3% 4% All Clinics SI UC 7% 8% Low missed 4 & 8 month visits 6) One SI lost to follow-up 7) 7 UC and 5 SI drop-outs 8) High error correction memo rate 9) Problems noted by contractor: (a) Participants object to ECG at ST. Joseph and rest of exam at Northwestern (b) 3 participants live out of state - try to come in 3 participants not able to come in due to illness (c) Ethical problem of high risk UC participants asking MRFIT MD for.advice, diagnosis etc. (d) Ethical problem of SI's who do not continue to see personal physician Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/ngvh0227
